intro: Zeltnera madrensis, commonly known as the Madreña zeltnera, is a flowering plant native to the Chihuahuan Desert in Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
